Based on my web search, here are the key Harry Potter book sales figures and global statistics:

## Overall Series Sales

Harry Potter by J.K. Rowling is the best-selling book series in history, having sold more than 600 million copies worldwide as of February 2023. Over 500 million Harry Potter books have been sold worldwide in 80 languages, and on average, this means one in fifteen people in the world owns a Harry Potter book.

## Individual Book Sales

The first novel, Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, has sold in excess of 120 million copies, making it one of the best-selling books of all time.

The later books in the series (Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, Order of the Phoenix, Half-Blood Prince, and Deathly Hallows) have each sold approximately 65 million copies.

## Record-Breaking Sales

The last four books in the series consecutively set records as the fastest-selling books of all time, with the final installment, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, selling roughly 15 million copies worldwide within twenty-four hours of its release. More specifically:

- Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows holds the world record for fastest-selling book in history, having sold 15 million of its 65 million copies in the first day alone
- The final installment sold 8.3 million copies within 24 hours of its release in 2007
- With twelve million books printed in the first US run, it also holds the record for the highest initial print run for any book in history

## Regional Breakdown

As of August 2018, a staggering half a billion Harry Potter books had sold worldwide, 180 million of which were sold in the United States.

## Translation and Global Reach

As of June 2017, the series has been translated into 85 languages, placing Harry Potter among history's most translated literary works. The books have now been translated into over 80 different languages across the world, from Albanian to Azerbaijani to Hebrew to Hawaiian.

## Financial Impact

The total gross revenue from book sales is estimated at $7.7 billion. The Harry Potter brand has been estimated to be worth as much as $25 billion.

The Harry Potter series clearly stands as one of the most successful publishing phenomena in history, with unprecedented sales figures that have established multiple world records and created a global cultural impact.
